data.enText: medical
op
the process of cutting open a part of a person's body in order to remove or repair a damaged part

data.chText: 为她做肺部肿瘤切除手术
data.enText: an operation on her lung to remove a tumour
Will I need to have an operation ?

data.chText: 他接受了三个小时的心脏手术。
data.enText: He underwent a three-hour heart operation.

data.chText: 医生昨天夜里做了紧急阑尾炎手术。
data.enText: Doctors performed an emergency operation for appendicitis last night.
organized activity
an organized activity that involves several people doing different things
a security operation

data.chText: 警方发动了一次打击毒贩的大规模行动。
data.enText: The police have launched a major operation against drug suppliers.
the UN peacekeeping operations
business
a business or company involving many parts
a huge multinational operation
the activity or work done in an area of business or industry

data.chText: 这家公司的国外银行业务
data.enText: the firm's banking operations overseas
computer
an act performed by a machine, especially a computer

data.chText: 全部运算在三秒内完成。
data.enText: The whole operation is performed in less than three seconds.
machine/system
the way that parts of a machine or a system work; the process of making sth work

data.chText: 定期维修可保持发动机的顺畅运转。
data.enText: Regular servicing guarantees the smooth operation of the engine.

data.chText: 这个装置的操作非常简单。
data.enText: Operation of the device is extremely simple.
military activity
military activity

data.chText: 他是负责指挥作战行动的军官。
data.enText: He was the officer in charge of operations.
mathematics
a process in which a number or quantity is changed by adding, multiplying, etc.
in operation
working, being used or having an effect

data.chText: 这个系统已经运行六个月了。
data.enText: The system has been in operation for six months.

data.chText: 新路正在实施临时交通管制。
data.enText: Temporary traffic controls are in operation on New Road.
come into operation
to start working; to start having an effect
The new rules come into operation from next week.
put sth into operation
to make sth start working; to start using sth

data.chText: 现在应该执行我们的计划了。
data.enText: It's time to put our plan into operation.

simple_means.memory_skill: oper 工作 + ation 行为 → 操作

ex.zh: 重大行动；大企业；大手术
成功的行动（或企业、手术）

data.enText: in operation
working, being used or having an effect

data.chText: 这个系统已经运行六个月了。
data.enText: The system has been in operation for six months.

data.chText: 新路正在实施临时交通管制。
data.enText: Temporary traffic controls are in operation on New Road.
come into operation
to start working; to start having an effect
The new rules come into operation from next week.
put sth into operation
to make sth start working; to start using sth

data.chText: 现在应该执行我们的计划了。
data.enText: It's time to put our plan into operation.

tr: the activity of operating something (a machine or business etc.)
example: her smooth operation of the vehicle gave us a surprisingly comfortable ride

tr: a planned activity involving many people performing various actions
example: they organized a rescue operation
the biggest police operation in French history
running a restaurant is quite an operation
consolidate the companies various operations

tr: a process or series of acts especially of a practical or mechanical nature involved in a particular form of work
example: the operations in building a house
certain machine tool operations

tr: a medical procedure involving an incision with instruments
performed to repair damage or arrest disease in a living body
example: they will schedule the operation as soon as an operating room is available
he died while undergoing surgery
the problems at the end of the chapter demonstrated the mathematical processes involved in the derivation
they were learning the basic operations of arithmetic

tr: activity by a military or naval force (as a maneuver or campaign)
example: it was a joint operation of the navy and air force

tr: a business especially one run on a large scale
example: a large-scale farming operation
a multinational operation
they paid taxes on every stage of the operation
they had to consolidate their operations

tr: (psychology) the performance of some composite cognitive activity
an operation that affects mental contents
example: the process of thinking
the cognitive operation of remembering

tr: (computer science) data processing in which the result is completely specified by a rule (especially the processing that results from a single instruction)
example: it can perform millions of operations per second

tr: process or manner of functioning or operating
example: the power of its engine determines its operation
the plane's operation in high winds
they compared the cooking performance of each oven
the jet's performance conformed to high standards

tr: the state of being in effect or being operative
example: that rule is no longer in operation

value.def: An operation is a highly organized activity that involves many people doing different things.

example.ex: The rescue operation began on Friday afternoon...
example.tran: 救援行动于星期五下午开始。

example.ex: The soldiers were engaged in a military operation close to the Ugandan border.
example.tran: 这些士兵参加了乌干达边境附近的一次军事行动。

example.ex: ...a big operation against the drugs trade.
example.tran: 打击毒品交易的大规模行动

value.tran: （由大量人员参与、具有高度组织性的）活动，行动，工作

value.def: A business or company can be referred to as an operation .

example.ex: Thorn's electronics operation employs around 5,000 people...
example.tran: 索恩的电子公司雇用了约5,000名员工。

example.ex: The two parent groups now run their business as a single combined operation.
example.tran: 这两个母公司现在合并为一家企业经营业务。

value.def: When a patient has an operation, a surgeon cuts open their body in order to remove, replace, or repair a diseased or damaged part.

example.ex: Charles was at the clinic recovering from an operation on his arm.
example.tran: 查尔斯的胳膊动了手术，正在这家诊所进行康复治疗。

value.def: If a system is in operation, it is being used.

example.ex: Until the rail links are in operation, passengers can only travel through the tunnel by coach.
example.tran: 在铁路连线开通之前，乘客只能乘坐长途客车穿越隧道。

example.ex: ...the free banking system that has been in operation since the early eighties.
example.tran: 从80年代初就开始实行的自由银行制度

value.def: If a machine or device is in operation, it is working.

example.ex: There are three ski lifts in operation.

value.def: When a rule, system, or plan comes into operation or you put it into operation, you begin to use it.

example.ex: The Financial Services Act came into operation four years ago...
example.tran: 《金融服务法》于4年前开始实施。

example.ex: Cheaper energy conservation techniques have been put into operation in the developed world.
example.tran: 更经济的节能技术在发达国家已经投入使用。

trans: 工作原理；经营理念；操作原理
操作模式；工作模式；操作方式；工作方式；运行模式
作战与保养；操作与维修（护）
手术；外科疾病；外科手术；切开手术；外科手術
操作方法；作业方法；使用方法；使用方式；手术方法
工作原理；工作制度；操作方法；工况
系统操作；系统的作业；系统运行；作业系统
稳健经营；稳定操作；稳定生产；稳定运行
经营（营运）成本，业务费用

partsOfSpeech.dec: co 共同 + oper 工作 + ate 做，造成，使… → 共同工作 → 合作
co 共同 + oper 工作 + ation 行为，过程，状态，结果 → 合作
oper 工作 + able 可…的 → 能工作的 → 可操作的
oper 工作 + ate 使… → 使工作 → 操作
oper 工作 + ation 行为，过程，状态，结果 → 操作
